topic.title: I.S. Plate
topic.p: The I.S. Plate is a modified Atari 1050 with support for single, enhanced, and double density disks.

The "accurate sector timing" option is forced on when emulating I.S. Plate drives. This is to work around a bug in the ISP firmware where the firmware crashes and reboots if it sees more than about 100 sectors within a quarter of a second.

The US/IS Doubler emulation option in the ISP Lightspeed rev. 2.0 software will not work if the computer is set to NTSC. This is due to out of tolerance serial timing in the IS Doubler firmware preventing the computer from being able to receive. The timing is just barely within POKEY's requirements for an ideal PAL machine, but beyond what POKEY can receive for ideal NTSC. Your mileage may vary on real hardware due to real-world clock variance.
